dcterms:creator: H. Kim
J. T. Becker
F. Rudzicz
S. S. Xu
dcterms:description: The UASpeech corpus is the largest publicly available and widely used dysarthric speech dataset, containing approximately 103 hours of speech recorded from 29 speakers, including 16 dysarthric speakers and 13 control healthy speakers.
dcterms:title: UASpeech

dcterms:creator: F. Rudzicz
dcterms:description: The TORGO corpus is a dysarthric speech dataset containing approximately 13.5 hours of audio data from 8 dysarthric and 7 control healthy speakers, consisting of both short sentence and single word utterances.
dcterms:title: TORGO

dcterms:creator: J. T. Becker
dcterms:description: The DementiaBank Pitt corpus contains approximately 33 hours of audio data recorded over interviews between elderly participants and clinical investigators, designed for automatic speech recognition tasks.
dcterms:title: DementiaBank Pitt

dcterms:creator: S. S. Xu
dcterms:description: The Cantonese JCCOCC MoCA corpus contains conversations recorded from cognitive impairment assessment interviews between elderly participants and clinical investigators, designed for automatic speech recognition tasks.
dcterms:title: Cantonese JCCOCC MoCA
